original: ERIKSSON, Elow, Trädgårdsdirektör, Västerås, f Asker, öbr l, 27/9 76 av lantbr E Andersson o Christina Söder, gm Maria Lindhagen. Prakt från ett flertal trädgårdar, pri-vatlekt. Anst Solberga, Kilsmo, 93—95, Tullgarns slottsträdgård 95—97, Solberga, öbr, 97—99, eg trädgårdsrör m frö- o blomsterhdl Solberga Trädgårds AB (grund 99 AB 35), omf del av Eriksborg samt Rosenhill 5 med omr av öv l hektar o 1.500 kvm växthusyta, sed 00. Ag fastigh V.ås. Stdflm 28—42. Ordf V.ås fastigh.äg.frn 36—41, Västml distr av Sv Hdlsträdgårdsmäst frb. Ordf o styr.led Solberga trädg.AB, styr.led Trafik AB Västeråsfjärden, Västml l hemslöjdsfrn. Resor: Tyskl, Frankr, Ital 11, Engl 38, prisdom v int trädgårdsutst Gent, Belg, 33, 38, i Holl 35, 39. Av trycket: Bidrag i tidn Trädgårdsvärlden. Två GM f blomm o blomsterodl, ett flert hed.pris v öl trädgårdsutst. Hobbies: Blommor och orkidéer.
translated: ERIKSSON, Elow, Director of Gardens, Västerås, born in Asker, other location, on September 27, 1876, son of farmer E. Andersson and Christina Söder, married to Maria Lindhagen. Practical experience from several gardens, private lessons. Employed at Solberga, Kilsmo, 1893-1895, Tullgarn Castle Gardens, 1895-1897, Solberga, other location, 1897-1899, owner of garden trade with seed and flower trade, Solberga Trädgårds AB (established in 1899 and turned into AB 1935), including part of Eriksborg and Rosenhill 5, with an area of over hectares and 1,500 square meters of greenhouse space, since 1900. Owns properties in Västerås. Member of Västerås Property Owners' Association from 1936 to 1941, Western District of the Swedish Horticulturists' Association. Chairman and board member of Solberga Trädgårds AB, board member of Trafik AB Västeråsfjärden, Western District of the Swedish Handicrafts Association. Traveled to Germany, France, Italy in 1911, England in 1938, awarded judgeship at international garden exhibition in Ghent, Belgium in 1933 and 1938, in the Netherlands in 1935 and 1939. Published contributions in the magazine "Trädgårdsvärlden" (The Garden World). Received two gold medals for flower and flower cultivation, several honorary awards at national garden exhibitions. Hobbies: Flowers and orchids.
